rule.q: What is the maximum altitude for UAS flights?

answer: FAA UAS Operations (excerpt) Maximum altitude is 400 feet AGL unless within 400 feet of a structure. Maintain visual line of sight (VLOS) with the aircraft at all times.

citations.text: Maximum altitude is 400 feet AGL unless within 400 feet of a structure.
Do not operate under the influence of drugs or alcohol.
Maintain visual line of sight (VLOS) with the aircraft at all times.
Do not fly over people or moving vehicles.

spans.text: FAA UAS Operations (excerpt) Maximum altitude is 400 feet AGL unless within 400 feet of a structure. Maintain visual line of sight (VLOS) with the aircraft at all times.
Do not operate under the influence of drugs or alcohol.
